body:
April 19 (Reuters) - FTN Midwest Securities upgraded Intel Corp. (INTC.O) and Advanced Micro Devices Inc. AMD.N, saying the two rival chipmakers are changing strategy to move to a more conducive pricing environment.

The brokerage said it expects valuations for both stocks to rise once it becomes clear to investors that the two companies are settling into a more healthy duopoly -- one with higher average selling prices and gross margins.

“The rhetoric is shifting away from market share goals and towards gross margin objectives. We saw this with Intel Tuesday evening and expect to see the same from AMD,” the brokerage said.

It raised both the stocks to “buy” from “neutral.”

FTN said it expects Intel to see greater gross margin gains over the year as both companies shift strategy.

The brokerage noted that AMD’s capital spending cutback signals its move away from “capacity at any cost” and market share goals.

FTN set a price target of $30 on Intel and of $19 on AMD.

Intel shares rose 1.64 percent to $21.70 in afternoon trade on the Nasdaq, while AMD shares rose 4.24 percent to $14.50 on the New York Stock Exchange. (Reporting by Aditya Phatak in Bangalore)
header: UPDATE 1-RESEARCH ALERT-FTN Midwest upgrades Intel, AMD to buy
